summary: The concept of "medical travel," redirected to the preferred term "medical tourism," pertains to the practice of individuals traveling across borders to obtain healthcare services. Within the EU legal and regulatory framework, medical tourism raises important considerations regarding patient rights, cross-border healthcare directives, and the regulation of healthcare providers. The EU promotes patient mobility while ensuring that member states adhere to standards of safety and quality in medical services.
